workflow.name: GPT-4o: Twilio integration with auto follow-up features
workflow.description:
### How it works
‚Ä¢ Twilio webhook detects missed/unanswered calls automatically
‚Ä¢ Analyzes call context (time of day, business hours, weekend/weekday)
‚Ä¢ Checks CRM for existing customer data and purchase history (optional)
‚Ä¢ AI Chain (GPT-4o) generates personalized recovery messages for SMS and Email
‚Ä¢ Sends instant apology with booking link via SMS and/or Email
‚Ä¢ Logs all interactions to Airtable for tracking
‚Ä¢ Slack alerts sales team with customer priority and context
‚Ä¢ Waits 24 hours and checks if customer booked
‚Ä¢ Sends automatic follow-up SMS if no booking detected
‚Ä¢ Structured output parser ensures reliable JSON formatting

### Set up steps
‚Ä¢ **Time to set up:** 15-20 minutes
‚Ä¢ Add Twilio credential and configure phone number in both SMS nodes
‚Ä¢ Get Slack channel ID for sales team alerts
‚Ä¢ Create Airtable base with 10 columns (Caller_Number, Customer_Name, Call_Time, Priority, SMS_Sent, Email_Sent, Booking_Link, Status, Urgency_Score, Follow_Up_Date)
‚Ä¢ Replace booking URL with your Cal.com or Calendly link
‚Ä¢ Configure business email for SMTP sending
‚Ä¢ Update business phone and name in follow-up SMS
‚Ä¢ Add credentials: Twilio API, OpenAI (GPT-4o), Slack OAuth2, Airtable Token, SMTP Email
‚Ä¢ Replace placeholder IDs in Slack and Airtable nodes
‚Ä¢ Optional: Configure CRM API for existing customer lookup (or disable those nodes)

### What you'll need
‚Ä¢ **Twilio** - Phone number with SMS capability
‚Ä¢ **OpenAI API** - GPT-4o access for AI message generation
‚Ä¢ **Slack** - Standard workspace for sales alerts
‚Ä¢ **Airtable** - Free plan works for call tracking
‚Ä¢ **Email SMTP** - Gmail, SendGrid, or any SMTP provider
‚Ä¢ **Cal.com or Calendly** - Booking link for instant scheduling
‚Ä¢ **CRM API** (optional) - HubSpot, Salesforce, or custom CRM

### Who this is for
Service businesses, agencies, and sales teams that lose revenue from missed calls. Perfect for businesses with high call volume that need instant personalized follow-up to recover lost opportunities.

parameters.content:
## üìû Missed Call Revenue Recovery Bot

### üìã Setup Instructions

**Step 1: Configure Twilio**
‚Ä¢ Add Twilio credential (Account SID + Auth Token)
‚Ä¢ Replace `+15551234567` with your Twilio phone number (2 SMS nodes)
‚Ä¢ Webhook auto-configures when workflow activates

**Step 2: Configure Integrations**
üîπ **Slack Channel**
   ‚Ä¢ Channel ‚Üí View details ‚Üí Copy Channel ID
   ‚Ä¢ Replace `REPLACE_WITH_SLACK_SALES_CHANNEL_ID`

üîπ **Airtable**
   ‚Ä¢ Base ID from URL ‚Üí `appXXXXXXXXXXXXXX`
   ‚Ä¢ Table ID from URL ‚Üí `tblYYYYYYYYYYYY`
   ‚Ä¢ Columns: Caller_Number, Customer_Name, Call_Time, Priority, SMS_Sent, Email_Sent, Booking_Link, Status, Urgency_Score, Follow_Up_Date

üîπ **Business Details**
   ‚Ä¢ Booking URL: Replace `https://cal.com/your-business`
   ‚Ä¢ Email: Replace `your-business@example.com`
   ‚Ä¢ Follow-up SMS: Replace `+1-555-0100` and `Your Business Name`

**Step 3: Optional CRM**
‚Ä¢ Replace `https://your-crm-api.com` with your CRM endpoints
‚Ä¢ Add HTTP Header Auth credential
‚Ä¢ Or disable "Check Existing Contact" + "Check if Booked" nodes

**Step 4: Credentials**
‚úì Twilio API ‚úì OpenAI (GPT-4o) ‚úì Slack OAuth2
‚úì Airtable Token ‚úì SMTP ‚úì CRM API (optional)

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Workflow
**Missed Call** ‚Üí **Analyze Context** ‚Üí **CRM Lookup** ‚Üí **AI Response** ‚Üí **SMS/Email** ‚Üí **Merge Results** ‚Üí **Track Sent** ‚Üí **Log Airtable** ‚Üí **Slack Notify** ‚Üí **24h Wait** ‚Üí **Check Booking** ‚Üí **Follow-up SMS**

‚Ä¢ AI personalizes based on time/customer status
‚Ä¢ Tracks SMS/Email delivery automatically
‚Ä¢ 24h auto-follow-up if no booking detected

parameters.text:
=Generate a personalized missed call response for the following situation:

Customer Information:
- Name: {{ $json.customer_name }}
- Status: {{ $json.is_existing_customer ? 'Existing Customer' : 'New Prospect' }}
- Priority: {{ $json.priority_level }}
- Previous Purchases: {{ $json.previous_purchases }}

Call Context:
- Time: {{ $json.context.time_of_day }} on a {{ $json.context.day_type }}
- Business Hours: {{ $json.is_business_hours ? 'Yes' : 'No (After Hours)' }}
- Phone: {{ $json.caller_number }}

Create TWO versions:

1. SMS_MESSAGE (160 chars max): Friendly, apologetic, includes booking link placeholder
2. EMAIL_MESSAGE (200 words): Professional, personalized, multiple contact options

Return JSON with:
- sms: Brief apologetic message
- email_subject: Personalized subject line
- email_body: Professional email with [BOOKING_LINK] placeholder
- tone: warm/professional/urgent
- recommended_channel: sms/email/both

Tone should be:
- Warm and apologetic
- Acknowledge their attempt to reach us
- Offer immediate booking option
- Personalize based on customer status

parameters.message:
=Hi {{ $json.customer_name }},

We tried reaching you yesterday. Still interested in scheduling?

Book now: {{ $json.booking_link }}

Or call us: +1-555-0100

Thanks!
Your Business Name

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
